title: Lesson 4 - What dbt learns from your SQL
summary: Inspect metadata to see how dbt understands models without running them.
description: Compilation builds a manifest that records model names, referenced nodes, tags, and docs. dbt gains this context before a single query runs in your warehouse.
concept: dbt understands structure before it touches data.

revealSections.title: What dbt learned
revealSections.body: The manifest now shows customer_orders depending on two staging models with two downstream placeholders.

takeaway: dbt understands structure before it touches data.

models.title: customer_orders
models.description: Study the metadata, not the SQL changes.
models.sql:
select *
from {{ ref('stg_orders') }} o
join {{ ref('stg_customers') }} c
  on o.customer_id = c.customer_id
